result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald P Egge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerald P Egge

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bailiff's Office advises no order for DNA needed. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Judgment of conviction prepared.
and Notice of DNA and Witness List (Plaintiff's)
Final pre-trial on April 3, 2015 at 09:30 am.

SIGNATURE BOND SET 
- Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.

Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail amended.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.
Preliminary hearing on March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

- Cash bail has been set in the amount of $500.00  THIS CASH BAIL SHALL REVERT TO A SIGNATURE BOND IN THE AMOUNT OF $500.00 PER CASE UPON ADAMS COUNTY PROVIDING THE DANE COUNTY CLERK OF COURTS AN ADDRESS WHERE THE DEFENDANT CAN STAY.
  - Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Joseph E.
Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 7

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Tim Helmberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
